Title: Of Human Bondage
Cast: Leslie Howard, Bette Davis, Frances Dee, Kay Johnson, Reginald Denny, Alan Hale, Reginald Sheffield, Reginald Owen, Desmond Roberts, Charles Coleman, Frank Mills, Pat Somerset
Plot: A young man finds himself attracted to a cold and unfeeling waitress who may ultimately destroy them both. Abandoning artistic ambitions, sensitive and club-footed Philip Carey enrolls in medical school and falls in love with a waitress Mildred Rogers. She rejects him, runs off with a salesman and returns unmarried and pregnant. Philip gets her an apartment and they become engaged. Mildred runs off with another medical student. Philip takes her back again when she returns with her baby. She wrecks his apartment and burns the securities he needs to pay tuition. He gets a job as a salesman, has surgery on his foot, receives an inheritance, and returns to school where he learns Mildred is dying. Written by Ed Stephan <stephan@cc.wwu.edu>
Keywords: based on novel, waitress, baby, inheritance, medical student
Actors: Bette Davis, Leslie Howard, Frances Dee
Writer: Lester Cohen (screen play), W. Somerset Maugham (from the novel by)
Description: Directed by John Cromwell.  With Bette Davis, Leslie Howard, Frances Dee, Kay Johnson. A young man finds himself attracted to a cold and unfeeling waitress who may ultimately destroy them both.
